IDBVersionChangeEvent.summary: The IDBVersionChangeEvent interface of the IndexedDB API indicates that the version of the database has changed, as the result of an event handler function.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB
-Starting transactions:
-Using transactions:
-Setting a range of keys:
-Retrieving and making changes to your data:
-Using cursors:
-Reference example: To-do Notifications (View the example live).

IDBVersionChangeEventIDBVersionChangeEve.summary:
The IDBVersionChangeEvent() constructor
creates a new object, which is used to represent
when a version of the database has changed, as a result of the
event handler.

IDBVersionChangeEventNewVersion.summary:
The newVersion read-only property of the
interface returns the new version number of the
database.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB
-Starting transactions:
-Using transactions:
-Setting a range of keys:
-Retrieving and making changes to your data:
-Using cursors:
-Reference example: To-do Notifications (View the example live).

IDBVersionChangeEventNewVersion.value: A number that is a 64-bit integer or null if the database is being deleted.

IDBVersionChangeEventOldVersion.summary:
The oldVersion read-only property of the
interface returns the old version number of the
database.

remarks.para: When the opened database doesn't exist yet, the value of oldVersion is 0.
